required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Phase 2b Study of CSL112 in Subjects With Acute Myocardial Infarction.
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2b, Multi-center, Randomized, Placebo-controlled, Dose-ranging Study to Investigate the Safety and Tolerability of Multiple Dose Administration of CSL112 in Subjects With Acute Myocardial Infarction.

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

brief_summary.textblock: This is a multicenter randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled, parallel-group, dose-ranging phase 2b study to investigate the hepatic and renal safety and tolerability of multiple dose administration of two dose levels of CSL112 compared with placebo in subjects with acute myocardial infarction (AMI).

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Caregiver, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Prevention

primary_outcome.measure: Clinically important change in drug-induced liver injury
primary_outcome.description: A clinically important change in drug-induced liver injury is defined as a change (from baseline) in alanine aminotransferase (ALT) greater than 3 times the upper limit of normal (ULN) or a change in total bilirubin greater than 2 times ULN, that is confirmed upon repeat measurement.

primary_outcome.measure: Clinically important change in renal status
primary_outcome.description: A clinically important change in renal status is defined as a serum creatinine (Cr) increase to â‰¥ 1.5 x the baseline value that is confirmed upon repeat measurement.

secondary_outcome.measure: The time-to-first occurrence of a major adverse cardiovascular event (MACE)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the start of the first infusion up to 112 days after infusion
secondary_outcome.description: MACE includes: cardiovascular death, MI, ischemic stroke and hospitalization for unstable angina.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetic profile of apolipoprotein A-I (apoA-I) and phosphatidylcholine (PC)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and for 7 days after the first and last infusions
secondary_outcome.description: Baseline-corrected plasma apoA-I and PC concentrations

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and for 7 days after the first and last infusions
Before and for 7 days after the first and last infusions

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma apoA-I and PC area under the curve (AUC)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and for 7 days after the first and last infusions
secondary_outcome.description: Baseline corrected plasma apoA-I and PC AUC0-infinity, AUC0 last

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and for 7 days after the first and last infusions
Before and for 7 days after the first and last infusions

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma apoA-I and PC Volume of distribution at steady state
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and for 7 days after the first and last infusions
From the start of the infusion, up to approximately Day 112
secondary_outcome.description: The number of subjects with study-drug-related AEs

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the start of the infusion, up to approximately Day 112
secondary_outcome.description: The total number of subjects with any AE

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the start of the infusion, up to approximately Day 112
secondary_outcome.description: The number of subjects who experience bleeding events as defined by the Bleeding Academic Research Consortium (BARC) criteria (Mehran et al, 2011)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before infusion, up to approximately Day 112
secondary_outcome.description: The number of subjects with serum antibodies to CSL112

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before infusion, up to approximately Day 382.
secondary_outcome.description: Assessments (i.e., evidence of seroconversion or infection) will be conducted for hepatitis A virus (HAV), hepatitis B virus (HBV), hepatitis C virus (HCV), human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) 1/2, parvovirus B19

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in nucleic acid testing assessments
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before infusion, up to approximately Day 382.
secondary_outcome.description: Assessments (i.e., evidence of seroconversion or infection) will be conducted for HAV, HBV, HCV, HIV 1/2, parvovirus B19

arm_group.description: CSL112 (low dose) is to be administered as an intravenous (IV) infusion once weekly for 4 consecutive weeks.
CSL112 (high dose) is to be administered as an IV infusion once weekly for 4 consecutive weeks.
Placebo is to be administered as an IV infusion at the same frequency, volume and duration as either the low dose or high dose CSL112 infusion.

intervention.description: CSL112 is a novel formulation of apolipoprotein A-I (apoA-I) purified from human plasma and reconstituted to form high-density lipoprotein (HDL) particles.
0.9% weight/volume sodium chloride solution (ie, normal saline)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Men or women, at least 18 years of age, with evidence of myocardial necrosis in a clinical setting consistent with a type I (spontaneous) acute myocardial infarction (AMI), in the last week.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Ongoing hemodynamic instability
- Evidence of hepatobiliary disease
- Evidence of chronic kidney disease (CKD) (Stage III, IV, or V), defined as moderate or severe renal impairment or if subject is receiving dialysis
- Evidence of unstable renal function
- History of acute kidney injury after previous exposure to an intravenous contrast agent.
- Known history of allergies, hypersensitivity or deficiencies to CSL112 or any of its components
- Other severe comorbid condition, concurrent medication, or other issue that renders the subject unsuitable for participation in the study
